ETYMOLOGY: From Old English luflīc (pleasant, amiable), equivalent to love + -ly.

MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 令人愉快的；美丽的；迷人的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: What a lovely view we have from the balcony!
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们从阳台看出去的景色太美了！

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Excellent; very good or satisfactory (often used to express approval).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 极好的；非常令人满意的 (常用于表示认可)。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: "The car has been repaired." "Lovely, I'll pick it up this afternoon."
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: “车修好了。” “太好了，我今天下午去取。”

MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Despite his shyness, he has a genuinely lovely nature.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 尽管他很害羞，但他本质上是个非常可爱的人。

REGISTER: General, highly common, especially in UK English for expressing general approval.
